resources.string: The handstand push-up (press-up) - also called the vertical push-up (press-up) or the inverted push-up (press-up) also called \"commandos\" - is a type of push-up exercise where the body is positioned in a handstand to prepare the strength untill one has built adequate balance

A push-up s a common calisthenics exercise beginning from the prone position, or the front leaning rest position known in the military. By raising and lowering the body using the arms, push-ups exercise the pectoral muscles, triceps, and anterior deltoids

A dip is an upper-body strength exercise. Narrow, shoulder-width dips primarily train the triceps, with major synergists being the anterior deltoid, the pectoralis muscles (sternal, clavicular, and minor), and the rhomboid muscles of the back (in that order).
